info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 11:06AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of southeastern Missoula, northeastern Granite and south central Powell Counties through 1145 AM MDT... At 1104 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking intense snow showers along a line extending from near Evaro to 18 miles northwest of Drummond to near Garrison. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less and rapidly changing road conditions. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Drummond, Wye, Bonner-West Riverside, Garrison, East Missoula, Nimrod, Jens, New Chicago, Bearmouth, Clinton, Turah, Goldcreek and Hall. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 96 and 176. Highway 12 Garrison to MacDonald Pass between mile markers 0 and 2. Highway 93 S between mile markers 91 and 94. Highway 200 between mile markers 0 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
